workProjects.title: Envita Medical Center
workProjects.description: I built the back end in Laravel and the front end with jQuery and Sass. I created most of the design assets for Envita.com as well. The goal of the redesign was to improve the user experience with a more responsive and open UI as well as and making the content real-time searchable.
workProjects.technology: Laravel, MySQL, jQuery, Sass, Algolia, Illustrator, Photoshop

workProjects.title: Vertisis Custom Pharmacy
workProjects.description: I built the back end in Laravel and the front end with jQuery and Sass. I created most of the design assets for Vertisis.com as well.

workProjects.title: Unipathic Medicine
workProjects.description: I built the back end in Laravel and the front end with jQuery and Sass. I created most of the design assets for Unipathic.com as well.

workProjects.title: Jegs
workProjects.description: A responsive Websphere commerce implementation. My role was Front-end Developer/UI Developer. I primarily worked on the product detail and list sections, shipping, billing, and user wishlist sections as well as wishlist dialogue popup modals. I also had a role in writing the HTML, CSS, and Javascript for the Navigation menu bar for both desktop and responsive mobile views.

workProjects.title: Canon
workProjects.description: I created detailed mock-up illustrations for the "Check Out" process as well as the design assets for development while adhering to Canon's established style standards.

workProjects.title: Toshiba
workProjects.description: I designed the look and feel of the application as well as the design assets for development. "The Toshiba Global Commerce application provides a view into the future of commerce."

workProjects.title: Kaiser Permanente
workProjects.description: I created detailed mock-up illustrations for a Kaiser Permanente "MyHR" intranet site redesign based on wireframes and documented style standards established by Kaiser Permanente.

workProjects.title: Chanel
workProjects.description: I created a mock-up illustration for a Chanel mobile application. *NOT PICTURED* I also built a responsive mega-dropdown menu with jQuery for an employee-facing internal site.

sideProjects.title: Portfolio
sideProjects.subtitle: The BobbyPatterson.me site redesign was built with React.js, Redux, Express.js and styled with Sass
sideProjects.description: The BobbyPatterson.me site redesign was built with React.js, Redux, Express.js and styled with Sass. View my recent side projects, my featured work projects, and my Instagram Viewer on the About page. Autoplaying videos will only play while visible in the viewport.

sideProjects.title: Chatify
sideProjects.subtitle: An open-sourced chatroom application built with React.js and Socket.io
sideProjects.description: An open-sourced chatroom application built with React.js and Socket.io. A user can chat with the "community" or chat with another user privately with the ability to add other users into an existing chat.

sideProjects.title: Instagram Media Viewer
sideProjects.subtitle: A Simple Instagram Media Viewer built with React.js
sideProjects.description: A Simple Instagram Media Viewer built with React.js. Similar to viewing your own user profile via the desktop web version of Instagram.com, click on a thumbnail to view it in the modal pop up window. From there you can view the next post as well as the previous post. If the post is a carousel, you'll see the dots at the bottom of the image as well as additional "next" and "previous" buttons within the edges of the image/carousel. If the post is a video, you can click to play the video. Video sounds are muted by default, however if you click the unmute button on the top right of the video, you'll enable the sound. Each post has a dedicated media page for when a user is linked directly to the post. All Autoplaying video thumbnails will only play while visible in the viewport.

sideProjects.title: Forum
sideProjects.subtitle: A very basic forum built with Laravel
sideProjects.description: A very basic open-sourced forum built with Laravel, MySQL, and Vue.js. It is very much a work in progress and I do plan to update the UI from the existing boilerplate Bootstrap.css to something a bit more custom.
